institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: National Human Resources Development Consortium Operating Rules/Article 13 (Submission and review of business plan)
contents: Article 13 (Submission and review of business plan) ① In accordance with Article 13 of the regulations and the contents announced by the Corporation, the joint training center shall submit a business plan for the annual consortium business in the format of Business Manual No. 12 to the Corporation by the end of October of the relevant year. It must be submitted and registered with HRD-Net. ② When a joint training center submits a business plan pursuant to paragraph (1), it must submit it including the details of Annex 6 “Joint Training Center Performance Calculation Index” among the performance during the period determined by the Corporation. ③ When submitting a business plan pursuant to paragraph 1, the joint training center sets its annual headcount target at 500 or more. However, if there is a need to adjust the target number of people depending on the region, size, characteristics of each industry, selection period, etc., the chairman may adjust it through deliberation and resolution by the deliberation committee according to the results of the review. ④ Deleted 2020. 11. 12, ⑤ The review of the business plan shall be in accordance with Table 4, “Examination Standards and Review Methods for the Business Plan of the Joint Training Center.” ⑥ Deleted March 26, 2019, ⑦ When requesting reconsideration pursuant to Article 13 (3) of the Regulations, the Chairman may request the relevant joint training center to supplement the business plan by setting a deadline. In this case, if the joint training center fails to submit a supplemented business plan by the deadline set by the Corporation without justifiable reasons, the subsidy may not be provided. ⑧ In accordance with Article 20-2 of the Regulations, when reviewing the integrated business plans of large and small coexistence joint training centers and corporate universities, the Chairman may allow training facilities and equipment to be jointly utilized for each business. Revised 2022. 6. 28.
